snippet: Prime Minister Wen Jiabao of China said the areas of agreement included “some important breakthroughs.”
abstract: United States and Chinese leaders announce important progress on a range of economic issues at annual bilateral meeting; China has agreed to remove some subsidies and favorable regulations affecting state-owned corporations and to allow foreigners to take bigger stakes in Chinese securities firms.

byline.original: By MICHAEL WINES and ANNIE LOWREY
byline.contributor: Michael Wines reported from Beijing and Annie Lowrey from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Wen Jiabao of China said the areas of agreement included “some important breakthroughs.”

headline.main: China Agrees to Measures to Ease Trade
headline.print_headline: Progress Seen on Economic Issues in U.S.-China Talks
